title: Headphone

adjectives: Containing or constituting or characterized by pleasing melody
verbs: To perceive sounds through the ear.
To perceive sound with the ear, without necessarily paying attention to it.
nouns: A lightweight and task-specific add-in program that integrates with applications to expose data at a glance.
A unit of execution within the Microsoft support diagnostic tool (MSDT) XML.
A graphical control element or widget is an element of interaction in a graphical user interface, such as a button or a scroll bar.
A device or control that is very useful for a particular job
A gadget is a small tool such as a machine that has a particular function, but is often thought of as a novelty.
Component of a graphical user interface that the user interacts with.
Element of a graphical user interface (GUI)
An interface element that a computer user interacts with, such as a window or a text box.
Any one of the components of a computer application's graphical user interface, such as a Cancel button or text input box that a user interacts with.
Part of a graphical user interface (GUI) that allows a user to control and change the appearance of elements for operating an application.
Someone who is passionate about music.
Music is an art form whose medium is sound.
Music is an art form that involves sounds and silence.
A sound, or the study of such sounds, organized in time.
The artistic organization of sounds or tones that expresses ideas and emotions through the elements of rhythm, melody, harmony and tonal color.
Form of art using sound
An app that facilitates the playing of music.
Sound, organized in time in a melodious way.
An artistic form of auditory communication incorporating instrumental or vocal tones in a structured and continuous manner
The title of the hub for music and video.
A pair of small loudspeakers worn inside each outer ear or covering all or part of the ear, without a connecting band worn over head.
A transducer that converts electric signals into sound and is held near the ear, especially as part of a telephone; an earpiece or headphone.
Small speakers worn over the ears.
A pair of speakers worn over or in the ears so only the wearer can hear the sound.
Electro-acoustic transducer for converting electric signals into sounds; it is held over or inserted into the ear
A sound receiver that fits in or over the ear, as of a radio or telephone.
Electro-acoustic transducer for converting electric signals into sounds; it is held over or inserted into the ear.
Headphones are a pair of small loudspeakers that are designed to be held in place close to a user's ears.
A pair of headphones meant to be worn on the head, such as those used with stereo installations.
Pair of small speakers held close to a user's ears
A listening device placed or worn in the ear, usually sold in pairs

description:
Headphones, used to listen to music or other forms audio, such as podcasts. Most platforms display this emoji with large over-ear headphones in shades of black, blue, and gray.

Apple previously displayed this emoji as iconic iPod white earbuds, followed by black Beats headphones in 2016, and in 2021 switched to display white AirPods Max.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's headphone emoji is a sleek and iconic representation of audio listening. It features a modern, over-ear design with plush earcups and a comfortable headband, all rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting. On Apple devices, its smooth gradients and clean lines evoke a sense of immersive sound and personal enjoyment, making it a perfect emoji for discussing music, podcasts, or any audio experience.
